introduction.p: Here is a brief overview of basic results and definitions concerning sets and the reals that should be assumed for this course.

ul.li: \mb R is the set of real numbers.
\mb Z is the set of integers.
\mb N=\setBuilder{z\in\mb Z}{z\geq 0}=\setList{0,1,2,\dots} is the set of natural numbers, which includes zero.
\mb Q=\setBuilder{\frac{z}{n+1}}{z\in\mb Z,n\in\mb N} is the set of rational numbers.

theorem.p: De Morgan's Laws: Let \mc A be a collection of subsets of X.
The Archemedian Property of the real numbers guarantees that for each positive real number x>0, there exists a natural number n\in\mb N such that \frac{1}{n}\lt x.
Let S\subseteq \mb R be a set of real numbers with a lower bound. Then there exists a greatest lower bound (a.k.a. infimum) \glb S=\inf S.
Let S\subseteq \mb R be a set of real numbers with a lower bound. Then there exists a least upper bound (a.k.a. supremum) \lub S=\sup S.
